Existing evidence does not suggest a mortality benefit from NSAIDs in people with Parkinson's disease. The current evidence base is limited due to the differing methodologies employed in the trials and inconsistencies in reporting of outcomes. We found no clear evidence to support routine antiepileptic drug treatment of craniopharyngiomas with bleomycin with the aim of reducing the icky feeling in the abdomen and improving quality of life measures in these patients.
